name: 3Intro
_source: # Alice awakens at the mouth of a cave. Marcel is nowhere to be seen.
speak;Marcel;Must be something wrong with your head...;no_block
speak;Alice;Hey, hold on, hey, wait a sec -;no_block
speak;Marcel;How many fingers am I holding up?
speak;Alice;What -{w} what happened to us, Marcel?{w}{clear}I know we fell into the river,{w} but what happened?

speak;Marcel;We floated around while the current carried us to this cave here.{w}{clear}You hit your head on one of the rocks jutting out,{w} and it cut open.{w}{clear}Bandaged it up as best as I could.{w}{clear}Said you were fine aside from the pain.{w}{clear}How do you feel?
speak;Alice;Like I didn't get enough sleep.
speak;Alice;Where are we now,{w} do you know?

speak;Marcel;I'm not too sure.{w}{clear}Think the river runs into this cave here,{w} and goes down underground,{w} and then probably into the sea.{w}{clear}Might have travelled a long distance.{w}{clear}Probably not far from the coast.
speak;Alice;Will the others be able to find us?
speak;Marcel;Anthony has a map,{w} he should be able to find us so long as we stay put.
speak;Alice;The same can be said for those who sprung the trap on us.
speak;Alice;We've got nothing to defend ourselves with.
speak;Alice;Marcel -{w} while I don't doubt your skills as a swordsman,{w} I highly doubt that a wooden stick would be...{w} able to...
# Marcel conjures up his Conceptual Weapon
speak;Alice;That's -{w} but how did -{w} how did you do that?
speak;Marcel;As long as the shape somewhat conforms to a sword,{w} I can make it. It's a conceptual weapon.
speak;Marcel;A weapon based on an imaginary concept.
speak;Alice;Is it a form of magical enhancement?{w}{clear}An illusion?
speak;Marcel;It would take a while,{w} not sure this is the best place -
speak;Alice;Um.{w}{clear}Something that can't be improved upon.
speak;Marcel;In reality, what would that be?
speak;Marcel;Difficult to picture in your head?
speak;Alice;There's no example that comes to mind.

speak;Marcel;Exactly, that's the problem.{w}{clear}While easy to define in an abstract sense,{w} perfection is very difficult to manifest in reality,{w} due to the inherently unrealistic qualities of perfection itself.{w}{clear}It's difficult to imagine a perfect object,{w} one symbolizing everyone's idea of perfection -{w} because such a thing,{w} in reality,{w} doesn't exist.{w}{clear}Are you with me so far?

speak;Marcel;Therefore, the image of perfection has to compromise.{w}{clear}In order to tether it to reality,{w} one can channel the image,{w} to an object that already exists,{w} so that the image can manifest as something real.{w}{clear}In this case,{w} a sword.{w}{clear}But the end result of conceptualizing a so-called perfect sword...{w} would likely be nothing more than a regular sword.{w}{clear}Maybe it might shine a little brighter when it catches the sunlight,{w} nothing more.{w}{clear}The idea of perfection as simply perfection is itself too vague.{w}{clear}Does that make sense?

speak;Marcel;So, rather than reaching for some vague notion,{w} a Conceptual Weapon is formed of the various qualities,{w} or notions,{w} that the wielder believes to lead to perfection.{w}{clear}Qualities that are,{w} in other words,{w} closest to wielder's perceived notions...{w} of what perfection should be.
speak;Alice;But if a Conceptual Weapon is formed from the imagination,{w} why isn't the weapon all-powerful?

speak;Marcel;The strength is based on the strength of the wielder's convictions.{w}{clear}The stronger the wielder's beliefs are in the things that they fight for,{w} the greater the strength of the weapon.
speak;Alice;So if you believe...{w} so essentially...{w} the sword you hold in your hands...{w} is a manifestation of what you believe in?
speak;Marcel;It's embarrassing to say out loud.
speak;Alice;What's the harm in saying more?
speak;Marcel;Come on,{w} time to move,{w} we've been here long enough.
# Marcel moves off, then moves right back
speak;Malachy;Spread out and search both paths.
# Camera pans to Marcel and Alice
